title: Althea Marks
text: I am a perpetual learner driven by curiosity and the idea of building a world where human and environmental well-being can thrive. As an avid outdoors person, I find solace during a challenging climb up a snow-covered ridge. However, my most rewarding work is using data and technology to assemble a healthier planet and support a just society. I strive towards this goal with genuine interpersonal communication and a dose of levity, while learning from others and my mistakes.

title: Native Olympia Oyster Collaborative Synthesis
text:
Overview
As the Database Analyst for NOOC (Native Olympia Oyster Collaborative), I built an online data collection survey (Qualtrics) and created a database of all Olympia oyster restoration projects. This required partnering with 23 government, non-profit, and academic organizations and working closely with the NOOC core team. I build data visualizations (Figure 2) and maps (Figure 1) for the peer-reviewed paper and assisted with analyses.
